bibl.title: John Matthews v. Henry M. White. correspondents
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: District Court of the United States for the Western District of Washington

body.p: Copy of letter: in possession of John Matthews:

I, J.G. Wagner, of the town of Sudbury, District of Sudbury, Province of Ontario, Canada, employed at present by Gurofsky Company Steamship Agents, and fire brokers and previously engaged as a court interpreter for a period of four years; also proprietor of general groceries and dry goods store, Reference, Bank of Ontario, Sudbury, Ontario, do hereby certify that I know Jack Matthews, formerly of this town, personally for the last six years, and have always found him to be an upright honest and industrious young man, most of the time employed as as a miner with this district, In my opinion deserves to be treated as the best of our citizens.

I, N.W. Narajowsk, of the town of Sudbury, in the District of Sudbury, Province of Ontario, Canada, manufacterer of boots and shoes; also property owner , Reference, Bank of Hochelago, do hereby certify that I know Mr. Jack Matthews of this town personally for the last two years, as an honest, upright, and industrious person, constantly employed as a miner at the mines of this District.
The Norris Shoe Company (sgd) N.W. Narajowski
This is to certify that I have known Mr. Jack Matthews for a number of years, and always found him to be honest, and particularly reliable.
(sgd) J.G. Barron. Mine Supt. Moose Mt. Ltd. Canadian Citizen
